descriptions.description: GLib provides advanced data structures, such as memory chunks, doubly and singly linked lists, hash tables, dynamic strings and string utilities, such as a lexical scanner, string chunks (groups of strings), dynamic arrays, keyed data lists, relations and tuples and routines for memory management and threads.

set.commands:
PACKAGE_NAME=glib PACKAGE_VERSION=2.36.4
oegimport libiconv oegimport zlib oegimport libffi # required oegimport gettext # required #oegimport pcre #oegimport python # compile-time only; really needed?
oegimport automake # compile-time only; docs directory; needs autoconf, m4, perl oegimport m4
oegextract ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}.tar.xz
oegpatch 001 # missed a cast in test program gdatetime.exe
mkdir -p "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}" cp AUTHORS COPYING README "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}/"
configure --prefix=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-sysroot=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-gnu-ld --bindir=${OEG_BASE_BIN_DIR} --libdir=${OEG_BASE_LIB_DIR} ${CONFIGURE_HOST_PARA} --with-threads=win32 --with-pcre=internal --with-libiconv=gnu make make install-strip DESTDIR=${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}
cd "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}"
mv bin/*.dll bin64/ rm -rf bin # TODO: Do we need to edit the .la files in lib64?
oegarchive ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}
